definition[0]: something that happens or exists as a result of things that happened at an earlier time
example[0]: The invasion left a legacy of hatred and fear.
example[1]: a legacy from the colonial period
definition[1]: money or property that you receive from someone after they die
example[2]: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
definition[2]: a legacy system, piece of software etc is one that people continue to use, although more modern ones are available
definition[3]: a situation that exists as a result of things that happened at an earlier time
example[3]: Hotels are in oversupply, a legacy of the last building boom.
example[4]: His death would secure her a legacy.
example[5]: Many people want to leave a legacy to a charity they have supported all their lives.
definition[4]: old and no longer sold, but still used by some people
example[6]: The software offers automated integration with legacy systems.
